trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: F0D47E70-0BA1-4A06-B2F3-0232C496709D
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: F0D47E70-0BA1-4A06-B2F3-0232C496709D

trans-unit.source: title: Frequently asked questions
trans-unit.target: title: Frequently asked questions

trans-unit.source: Frequently Asked Questions
trans-unit.target: Frequently Asked Questions

trans-unit.source: Last updated: May 1, 2015
trans-unit.target: Last updated: May 1, 2015

trans-unit.source: What is a Windows Server Container?
trans-unit.target: What is a Windows Server Container?

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers are a lightweight operating system virtualization method used to separate applications or services from other services running on the same container host.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers are a lightweight operating system virtualization method used to separate applications or services from other services running on the same container host.

trans-unit.source: To enable this, each container has its own view of the operating system, processes, file system, registry, and IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: To enable this, each container has its own view of the operating system, processes, file system, registry, and IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: What is the difference between Linux and Windows Server Containers?
trans-unit.target: What is the difference between Linux and Windows Server Containers?

trans-unit.source: Linux and Windows Server Containers are similar -- both implement similar technologies within their kernel and core operating system.
trans-unit.target: Linux and Windows Server Containers are similar -- both implement similar technologies within their kernel and core operating system.

trans-unit.source: The difference comes from the platform and workloads that run within the containers.
trans-unit.target: The difference comes from the platform and workloads that run within the containers.

trans-unit.source: When a customer is using Windows Server Containers, they can integrate with existing Windows technologies such as .NET, ASP.NET, PowerShell and more.
trans-unit.target: When a customer is using Windows Server Containers, they can integrate with existing Windows technologies such as .NET, ASP.NET, PowerShell and more.

trans-unit.source: What is a Hyper-V Container?
trans-unit.target: What is a Hyper-V Container?

trans-unit.source: You can think of a Hyper-V Container as a Windows Server Container running inside of a Hyper-V partition.
trans-unit.target: You can think of a Hyper-V Container as a Windows Server Container running inside of a Hyper-V partition.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Containers offer an additional deployment option between the highly efficient, high-density Windows Server Container and the highly isolated hardware-virtualized Hyper-V virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Containers offer an additional deployment option between the highly efficient, high-density Windows Server Container and the highly isolated hardware-virtualized Hyper-V virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For environments where applications from different trust boundaries on the same host, additional isolation may be required.
trans-unit.target: For environments where applications from different trust boundaries on the same host, additional isolation may be required.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Containers will provide higher isolation using an optimized virtualization and Windows Server operating system that separates containers from each other and from the host operating system.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Containers will provide higher isolation using an optimized virtualization and Windows Server operating system that separates containers from each other and from the host operating system.

trans-unit.source: Both container deployment options utilize the same management APIs, tools and image formats, at deployment time, customers can simply choose which deployment mode best meets their requirements.
trans-unit.target: Both container deployment options utilize the same management APIs, tools and image formats, at deployment time, customers can simply choose which deployment mode best meets their requirements.

trans-unit.source: When will Hyper-V Containers be available for use?
trans-unit.target: When will Hyper-V Containers be available for use?

trans-unit.source: We expect to deliver a preview of Hyper-V Containers this calendar year.
trans-unit.target: We expect to deliver a preview of Hyper-V Containers this calendar year.

trans-unit.source: Will Hyper-V Containers also be available to the Docker ecosystem?
trans-unit.target: Will Hyper-V Containers also be available to the Docker ecosystem?

trans-unit.source: Yes – Hyper-V Containers will provide the same level of integration and management with Docker as Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: Yes – Hyper-V Containers will provide the same level of integration and management with Docker as Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.source: The goal is to have an open, consistent, cross-platform experience.
trans-unit.target: The goal is to have an open, consistent, cross-platform experience.

trans-unit.source: The Docker platform will also greatly simplify and enhance the experience of working across our container options.
trans-unit.target: The Docker platform will also greatly simplify and enhance the experience of working across our container options.

trans-unit.source: An application developed using Windows Server Containers can be deployed as a Hyper-V Container without change.
trans-unit.target: An application developed using Windows Server Containers can be deployed as a Hyper-V Container without change.

trans-unit.source: Why do I have to pick between Docker and PowerShell for Windows Server Container management?
trans-unit.target: Why do I have to pick between Docker and PowerShell for Windows Server Container management?

trans-unit.source: This isn't desired behavior nor our long term plan. PowerShell container management tools and Docker container management tools will work side by side in the future.
trans-unit.target: This isn't desired behavior nor our long term plan. PowerShell container management tools and Docker container management tools will work side by side in the future.

trans-unit.source: With that said, using multiple management interfaces to manage the same container can be difficult.
trans-unit.target: With that said, using multiple management interfaces to manage the same container can be difficult.

trans-unit.source: Take, for example, creating a container with PowerShell and naming the image with an upper case character.
trans-unit.target: Take, for example, creating a container with PowerShell and naming the image with an upper case character.

trans-unit.source: Docker doesn’t support caps, PowerShell does.
trans-unit.target: Docker doesn’t support caps, PowerShell does.

trans-unit.source: While that specific example is very manageable, what gets much harder are handing state changes (race conditions and different expectations), feature set differences or versions…
trans-unit.target: While that specific example is very manageable, what gets much harder are handing state changes (race conditions and different expectations), feature set differences or versions…

trans-unit.source: Our short term decision was that management interfaces (in this case Docker and PowerShell) only see containers they created – you create a container with Docker and PowerShell doesn’t see it, you create it with PowerShell and Docker doesn’t see it.
trans-unit.target: Our short term decision was that management interfaces (in this case Docker and PowerShell) only see containers they created – you create a container with Docker and PowerShell doesn’t see it, you create it with PowerShell and Docker doesn’t see it.

trans-unit.source: As a developer, do I have to re-write my app for each type of container?
trans-unit.target: As a developer, do I have to re-write my app for each type of container?

trans-unit.source: No, Windows container images are common across both Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers.
trans-unit.target: No, Windows container images are common across both Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers.

trans-unit.source: The choice of container type is made when you start the container.
trans-unit.target: The choice of container type is made when you start the container.

trans-unit.source: From a developer standpoint, Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers are two flavors of the same thing.
trans-unit.target: From a developer standpoint, Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers are two flavors of the same thing.

trans-unit.source: They offer the same development, programming and management experience, are open and extensible and will include the same level of integration and support via Docker.
trans-unit.target: They offer the same development, programming and management experience, are open and extensible and will include the same level of integration and support via Docker.

trans-unit.source: A developer can create a container image using a Windows Server Container and deploy it as a Hyper-V Container or vice-versa without any changes other than specifying the appropriate runtime flag.
trans-unit.target: A developer can create a container image using a Windows Server Container and deploy it as a Hyper-V Container or vice-versa without any changes other than specifying the appropriate runtime flag.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers will offer greater density and performance (e.g. lower spin up time, faster runtime performance compared to nested configurations) for when speed is key.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers will offer greater density and performance (e.g. lower spin up time, faster runtime performance compared to nested configurations) for when speed is key.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Containers offer greater isolation, ensuring that code running in one container can't compromise or impact the host operating system or other containers running on the same host.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Containers offer greater isolation, ensuring that code running in one container can't compromise or impact the host operating system or other containers running on the same host.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for multitenant scenarios (with requirements for hosting untrusted code) including SaaS applications and compute hosting.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for multitenant scenarios (with requirements for hosting untrusted code) including SaaS applications and compute hosting.

trans-unit.source: Are Hyper-V/Windows Server Containers an add-on, or will they integrated within Windows Server?
trans-unit.target: Are Hyper-V/Windows Server Containers an add-on, or will they integrated within Windows Server?

trans-unit.source: The container capabilities will be integrated into Windows Server 2016.
trans-unit.target: The container capabilities will be integrated into Windows Server 2016.

trans-unit.source: Stay tuned for more information closer to the general availability.
trans-unit.target: Stay tuned for more information closer to the general availability.

trans-unit.source: What are the prerequisites for Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers?
trans-unit.target: What are the prerequisites for Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers?

trans-unit.source: Both Window Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers require Windows Server 2016.
trans-unit.target: Both Window Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers require Windows Server 2016.

trans-unit.source: These technologies will not work with previous versions of Windows.
trans-unit.target: These technologies will not work with previous versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: Are Nano Server based containers supported?
trans-unit.target: Are Nano Server based containers supported?

trans-unit.source: For the TP3 release, no they are not.
trans-unit.target: For the TP3 release, no they are not.

trans-unit.source: Only Server Core based containers are currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Only Server Core based containers are currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Can I run Windows Server Containers on ESXi or another non Hyper-V hypervisor?
trans-unit.target: Can I run Windows Server Containers on ESXi or another non Hyper-V hypervisor?

trans-unit.source: Yes, Windows Server Container run on any TP3 Server Core installation.
trans-unit.target: Yes, Windows Server Container run on any TP3 Server Core installation.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions for <link><linkText>enabling the containers feature in-place</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions for <link><linkText>enabling the containers feature in-place</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Is Microsoft participating in the Open Container Initiative (OCI)?
trans-unit.target: Is Microsoft participating in the Open Container Initiative (OCI)?

trans-unit.source: To guarantee the packaging format remains universal, Docker recently organized the Open Container Initiative (OCI), aiming to ensure container packaging remains an open and foundation-led format with Microsoft as one of the founding members.
trans-unit.target: To guarantee the packaging format remains universal, Docker recently organized the Open Container Initiative (OCI), aiming to ensure container packaging remains an open and foundation-led format with Microsoft as one of the founding members.

trans-unit.source: Is Microsoft really partnering with Docker?
trans-unit.target: Is Microsoft really partnering with Docker?

trans-unit.source: Yes.
trans-unit.target: Yes.

trans-unit.source: Our partnership with Docker enables developers to create, manage and deploy both Windows Server and Linux containers using the same Docker tool set.
trans-unit.target: Our partnership with Docker enables developers to create, manage and deploy both Windows Server and Linux containers using the same Docker tool set.

trans-unit.source: Developers targeting Windows Server will no longer have to make a choice between using the vast range of Windows Server technologies and building containerized applications.
trans-unit.target: Developers targeting Windows Server will no longer have to make a choice between using the vast range of Windows Server technologies and building containerized applications.

trans-unit.source: Docker is two things, the open source group of projects and Docker the company.
trans-unit.target: Docker is two things, the open source group of projects and Docker the company.

trans-unit.source: We consider this partnership to include both.
trans-unit.target: We consider this partnership to include both.

trans-unit.source: Docker is successful, in part, because of the vibrant ecosystem that has built up around the Docker container technology.
trans-unit.target: Docker is successful, in part, because of the vibrant ecosystem that has built up around the Docker container technology.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft is contributing to the Docker Project, enabling support for Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft is contributing to the Docker Project, enabling support for Windows Server Containers and Hyper-V Containers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <link><linkText>New Windows Server containers and Azure support for Docker</linkText><title></title></link> blog post.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <link><linkText>New Windows Server containers and Azure support for Docker</linkText><title></title></link> blog post.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Back to Container Home</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Back to Container Home</linkText><title></title></link>
